page.title: 02MARSTON MAGNA CHURCH.
page.content: St. Mary the Virgin Church in Marston Magna can be divided into two parts. Evidently the east end is the oldest because of the herringbone pattern of bricks, a feature of saxon building. An expert has partially revealed a wall painting of Thomas a'Becket who was an Archbishop of Canterbury being beheaded by four knights said to have come from Somerset. A fine Norman font with scallop shaped moulding has the original stem,base and lead lining. Modern features include a weather vane erected in 1977 to commemorate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth 11. The ladies of the village embroidered the kneelers and there are two special ones made when the heir to the throne Prince Charles married Princess Diana. This church has been a centre of religion for many generations.
